alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 16 at 3:39PM EDT until March 17 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 2 PM EDT FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches...heaviest in the Huron Mountains and higher terrain west of Marquette through Friday. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 11 inches possible Friday night through Saturday. The heaviest in the higher terrain areas west and northwest of a line from Gwinn to Big Bay and locally higher amounts in the Huron Mountains. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph near the Lake Superior shoreline. * WHERE...Marquette County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from midnight tonight to 2 PM EDT Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact multiple morning and evening commutes through Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will be preceded by a period of rain this evening before a change over to wet snow after midnight tonight. This may lead to slick road conditions tonight into early Friday. The heavy snow will come in two rounds. The first round will be late tonight into Friday morning. Round two will be heavy lake effect snow late Friday afternoon into Saturday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
